intro: Hieracium fulcratum subsp. knappianum, commonly known as the Knapp's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in composite inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a distinctive shape, aiding in its identification.
